coscup-pass.title: COSCUP Pass 報到 App 開發秘辛
coscup-pass.introduction: A seminar with more than a thousand of participant, COSCUP Pass is a new attempt by the CPRTeam at this year's COSCUP when only 30 minutes of registation time is avaliable, which means an average of 40 participant finish check-in per minute. This presentation is going to introduce the overall system architecture and design planning, focusing on Andorid to use the relevant technology, and how to use dynamic link of Google Firebase to give users a timeless and smooth installation login experience.

speakers.name: Denny Huang
speakers.introduce: Co-founder of SITCON, organizer of SITCON 2013 and 2014, currently being a game backend engineer in Rayark Inc.; Having a special and different path in regular education, hoping to change Taiwan to become better through education, love opensource and a variety of technologies beside User Interface (UI).

php.title: Learning PHP: How to get started

speakers.name: Wan Leung Wong
speakers.community: Hong Kong Creative Open Technology Association

git.title: Git: How to master your source code files like a Pro
git.introduction: Have you ever gone crazy for your source code files? Or did you ever want to share your software projects with others on Github? Here is a quick intro for you. From nothing to professional. (Bring your notebook if possible)

FOSS-security.title: Using FOSS for security: how open source protects your privacy
FOSS-security.introduction: Why should students and academics be concerned about privacy, and how can they protect themselves in cyberspace without expensive security tools?We will discuss about surveillance, power of open source security software such as Whisper Systems, Quicktun, PGP, and encrypting hard drives using open source tools. In a nutshell, we want to empathize that we can achieve greater privacy for individuals by utilizing shared public data on open source platforms.

IoT.title: IoT made easy: using Raspberry Pi and Sensortags
IoT.introduction: This talk will talk about how Raspberry Pi 3 can connect to a TI sensortags via bluetooth by Node.js. And how to stream real time data to the browser using Websocket. In addition, building a QR reader using a webcam and Raspberry Pi.

skygear.title: Building a chat app quick with Skygear - an Open-source BaaS
skygear.introduction: Building a full feature app isn't easy - it involves front-end UI and backend architecture.  how to Skygear (http://skygear.io) - an open source BaaS to build mobile apps. We will do a live demo on how to build a chat app without writing a line of backend code.

SITCON-open-source.title: SITCON From Past to Future and Contribute Open Source
